channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why the U.S. consumer may be more resilient than many think
item.description: The U.S. consumer may have more resilience to the onslaught of tariffs than many assume.

item.title: This veteran investor crunches the numbers and sees the risk of a full-blown bear market
item.description: Kotok in his latest email to clients walks through an estimate of just how much tariffs will take a bite out of corporate earnings.

item.title: ‘I’m an idiot’: I’m middle aged, earn $68,000 a year and have $39,000 in credit-card debt
item.description: “I plan on keeping the accounts open to protect my credit, but I will cut and toss all the cards so I can’t use them.”

item.title: My father’s widow keeps sending me $200 checks in the mail. Why would she do this?
item.description: “I sent a ‘thank you’ card and asked what it was for, but I got no answer.”

item.title: My ex-wife said she should have been compensated for working part time during our divorce 20 years ago. Do I owe her?
item.description: “My ex-wife and I both recently retired from federal government jobs, and have comfortable retirements.”

item.title: JPMorgan downgrades this streaming giant, says gains will be harder to come by after recent run
These two U.S. airline stocks are buys and can surge around 30% each, UBS says
item.description: The recent pause in tariffs between the U.S. and China could be an economic boon that aids airlines, the firm said.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts prefer these dividend stocks for stable returns
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service discusses three dividend-paying stocks, including Chevron and EOG Resources, highlighted by Wall Street's top pros.

item.title: Pilotless planes are taking flight in China. Bank of America says it's time to buy
item.description: While startups around the world have tried to build vehicles that can fly without a pilot, only one is certified to carry people — in China.

item.title: Irenic snaps up a stake in Couchbase. Here are two tracks the firm can take to create value
item.description: Activist Irenic has two paths to take at Couchbase to build value.
